p: Olive seed oil has 0.1% of phospholipids [ 34] and may have diverse technological uses in the soap, cosmetics and pharmaceutic industries [ 34]. Phospholipids from olive seeds can also be used for lecithin production in the agri-food industry [ 34]. Food derived phospholipids have several biomedical applications, for instance, as emulsifiers in pharmaceuticals and for the preparation of liposomes for cosmetics and drug delivery [ 44, 45].
